newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cash soymeal- Some truck basis offers lower.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cash soymeal- Some truck basis offers lower.

text.p: Some basis offers for soymeal in truck markets were lower Tuesday in U.S. cash markets, but trade was described as lackluster by most dealers.
"We've been giving out a lot of quotes this morning, and now we're just waiting to see if we get any trades," one broker in the Southeat said.
Most end-users are buying meal on a "hand-to-mouth" or as-needed basis in anticipation of lower soymeal prices later this month, dealers said.
"The market's there, but I think they're waiting for the basis to weaken," said one cash source.
"It worked for them in July, so they're going to try it again," he said.
One dealer in southern Indiana said basis was falling in his market because rail trade basis the Chicago market was less expensive.
The Hamburg, Germany-based newsletter Oil World forecast soymeal imports to China at 6.2 million tonnes in 1997/98, up from 3.4 million in 1996/97.
The newsletter raised its forecast because severe drought in important Chinese growing regions had damaged crops.
